options.description: Print USAGE and DESCRIPTION; ignore all other parameters
Print USAGE, DESCRIPTION and ARGUMENTS; ignore all other parameters
Print version number; ignore other arguments
Input file name Default = `-'
Input format for sequences Default = `fasta'
Input query sequences are paired
FASTA file with mates for query sequences (if given in another file)
Comma-separated SRA accessions
File with a list of SRA accessions, one per line
BLAST database name
Output file name Default = `-'
Output will be compressed
Report unaligned reads to this file
Minimum number of consecutive bases matching exactly Default = `18'
Cost to open a gap Default = `0'
Cost to extend a gap Default = `4'
Penalty for a nucleotide mismatch. Default = `-4'
Maximum allowed intron length Default = `500000'
Subject sequence(s) to search
Location on the subject sequence in 1-based offsets (Format: start-stop)
alignment view options: sam = SAM format, tabular = Tabular format, asn = text ASN.1 Default = sam
format for reporting unaligned reads: sam = SAM format, tabular = Tabular format, fasta = sequences in FASTA format Default = same as outfmt
Include MD tag in SAM report
Do not trim '.1', '/1', '.2', or '/2' at the end of read ids for SAM format andpaired runs
Do not report unaligned reads
Suppress discordant alignments for paired reads
Use lower case filtering in subject sequence(s)?
Reject low quality sequences Default = `true'
Remove word seeds with high frequency in the searched database Default = `true'
Words that appear more than this number of times in the database will be masked in the lookup table Default = `30'
Number of words to skip after collecting one while creating a lookup table Default = `0'
Restrict search of database to list of GIs
Restrict search of database to list of SeqIDs
Restrict search of database to everything except the specified GIs
Restrict search of database to everything except the specified SeqIDs
Restrict search of database to include only the specified taxonomy IDs (multiple IDs delimited by ',')
Restrict search of database to everything except the specified taxonomy IDs (multiple IDs delimited by ',')
Restrict search of database to include only the specified taxonomy IDs
Restrict search of database to everything except the specified taxonomy IDs
Filtering algorithm ID to apply to the BLAST database as soft masking
Filtering algorithm ID to apply to the BLAST database as hard masking
Percent identity cutoff for alignments Default = `0.0'
Strand specific reads forward/reverse
Strand specific reads reverse/forward
Should the query and subject defline(s) be parsed? Default = `true'
Enable SRA caching in local files
Number of threads (CPUs) to use in the BLAST search Default = `1'

Cutoff score for accepting alignments. Can be expressed as a number or a function of read length: L,b,a for a * length + b. Zero means that the cutoff score will be equal to: read length, if read length <= 20, 20, if read length <= 30, read length - 10, if read length <= 50, 40, otherwise. Default = `0'
Cutoff edit distance for accepting an alignment Default = unlimited
Search for spliced alignments Default = `true'
Type of the reference: genome or transcriptome Default = `genome'
